questions.question: Which of these is proper form of INLINE CSS Styling
questions.help: inline styling, is when you style directly on the HTML element, Don't use it too often, it isn't very flexible and clutters your code

questions.question: What goes in ---1---
questions.help: !DOCTYPE is a document type declaration and !DOCTYPE html informs the browser you will be using HTML5

questions.question: What does JSON stand for
questions.help: The correct answer is Java Script Object Notation

questions.question: How many heading tags are there in HTML
questions.help: There are 6, 1 being the largest, 6 being the smallest

questions.question: <--1--> What is the tag to create a line break in HTML(Just fill in do not use <>)
questions.help: br, or

questions.question: <--1--> What is the tag for paragraphs in HTML
questions.help: p, or

questions.question: <--1--> What is the tag for an unordered/bullet list in HTML
questions.help: ul or <ul>, <ol> for ordered list, <li> for list elements in your lists

questions.question: What does CSS stand for
questions.help: Casading Style Sheets

questions.question: What does HTML stand for
questions.help: HyperText Markup Language, HTML is a Markup Language

questions.question: What is used to create templates
questions.help: Handlebars is the template creator for JS and HTML, Bootstrap is for CSS, Flask is for python web developent

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a bootstrap base color
questions.help: Data is not a color, Warning is yellow, Danger is red, Info is teal

questions.question: How many sections is the Bootstrap Grid layout made out of
questions.help: 12 sections you can divide up

questions.question: Which of these symbol is an ID selector in CSS
questions.help: # is used for selecting ID

questions.question: Which of these symbol is an Class selector in CSS
questions.help: . is used to select classes

questions.question: What goes in the place of --4--
questions.help: innerHTML to change the HTML using the template, rendered in render_view

questions.question: What goes in the place of --2--
questions.help: fetch, grabs the data from the api at the end of the link, returns a promise

questions.question: What goes in the place of --3--
questions.help: await, the program pauses and waits for the promise to complete

questions.question: What goes in the place of --1--
questions.help: await, the program pauses and waits for the promise to complete

questions.question: What is the purpose of this function
questions.help: Async allows you to code synchronously while be asynchronous, await waits for promises to complete, fetch retrieves from the api

answers.text: To load some pictures from the database
To asynchronously acquire data from the api
To render a template using Handlebars

questions.question: Abstract classes are ...
questions.help: Abstract classes are accessed with keyword extends, and cannot have implementation or static and final modifiers. They can have declaration however

questions.help: boolean is the primitive type

questions.help: toString() is the method

questions.question: How do you get the length of an array
questions.help: length is a property of arrays you can access, array.length to access

questions.question: How do you get the length of an ArrayList
questions.help: ArrayList have a size method so to access length you use size()

questions.question: How do you add to the end of an ArrayList
questions.help: ArrayList have an add method so to access length you use add()

questions.help: Object name = new Object(); is the proper syntax
